meanings.definition: To make international in character or scope.
meanings.sent1: The company internationalised its operations by opening branches in different countries.
meanings.sent2: The organization decided to internationalise their products to reach a global market.
meanings.sent3: The chef internationalised the menu by adding dishes from various countries.
meanings.sent4: Her passion for travel internationalised her perspective on different cultures.
meanings.sent5: The music festival internationalised the event by inviting artists from around the world.

meanings.definition: To extend to or involve other countries or nations.
meanings.sent1: The company internationalised its supply chain to include suppliers from various countries.
meanings.sent2: The conflict internationalised when neighboring nations got involved.
meanings.sent3: The game of soccer internationalised when teams from different countries competed.
meanings.sent4: The virus quickly internationalised, spreading to multiple nations within weeks.
meanings.sent5: The trade agreement internationalised the economic relations between the two countries.
